I spent the first 20
years of my career

in clinical research and
academic practice in Italy.

In 2003, I left the hospital and
I moved to the pharma industry,

and I have been in leading
roles in medical affairs
in Italy and in Asia-Pacific.

After that, I moved
to Switzerland

to global product
development safety
which is my current function.

My focus is on the application
of digital health technology.

Allowing health care
professionals to dedicate more

time to human
aspects of medicine,

that cannot be replaced
by a computer software
or an algorithm.

Digital health technology
application in medicine

is still in its infancy,
and learning opportunities
are of utmost importance to me.

I chose Stanford
for many reasons.

First, Stanford University's
acknowledged center
for digital health technology.

Second, the course
program was comprehensive

and exactly addressing
my development needs.

Third, it was
available on demand,

with no time zones P
I liked the balance

between high-quality lectures
with an outstanding faculty.

Case studies and exercises
requiring personal data mining.

I got very interesting insights
from the regulatory perspective

in the US, where I
spend most of my time.

I'm definitely applying
many of the concepts
I learned in this course.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
